original_solution_mapping.L1: Harper collected 30% more than Maggie's 50 pieces of candy, so she collected .30*50 = <<30*.01*50=15>>15 more pieces of candy
original_solution_mapping.L2: Maggie has 50 pieces and Harper collected 15 more than her, so she has 50+15 = <<50+15=65>>65 pieces of candy
original_solution_mapping.L3: Neil collected 40% more than Harper, who has 65 pieces, so that's .40*65 = 26 more pieces of candy
original_solution_mapping.L4: Harper has 65 pieces and Neil collected 26 more than her, so he has 65+26 = <<65+26=91>>91 pieces of candy

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5443.
    Returns: the total amount of candy Neil got.
    """
    # L1
    maggie_candy = 50 # who only collected 50 pieces
    harper_more_percent_num = 30 # 30% more pieces of Halloween candy
    harper_more_percent_decimal = 0.30 # from solution text: .30*50
    percent_factor = 0.01 # WK
    harper_more_candy = harper_more_percent_decimal * maggie_candy

    # L2
    harper_total_candy = maggie_candy + harper_more_candy

    # L3
    neil_more_percent_num = 40 # 40% more candy
    neil_more_percent_decimal = 0.40 # from solution text: .40*65
    neil_more_candy = neil_more_percent_decimal * harper_total_candy

    # L4
    neil_total_candy = harper_total_candy + neil_more_candy

    # FA
    answer = neil_total_candy
    return answer

Maggie has {maggie_candy} pieces and Harper collected {harper_more_candy} more than her, so she has {maggie_candy}+{harper_more_candy} = <<{maggie_candy}+{harper_more_candy}={harper_total_candy}>>{harper_total_candy} pieces of candy
Neil collected {neil_more_percent_num}% more than Harper, who has {harper_total_candy} pieces, so that's {neil_more_percent_decimal}*{harper_total_candy} = {neil_more_candy} more pieces of candy

Harper has {harper_total_candy} pieces and Neil collected {neil_more_candy} more than her, so he has {harper_total_candy}+{neil_more_candy} = <<{harper_total_candy}+{neil_more_candy}={neil_total_candy}>>{neil_total_candy} pieces of candy
